definitions: card given to express love or affection on February fourteenth
person who is loved or cherished especially on Valentine's Day
examples: She received several valentines from her secret admirer
The store displays hundreds of valentines every February
Will you be my valentine this year for the dance
He's been her valentine for three consecutive years

definitions: hall in Norse mythology where warriors killed in battle feast eternally
examples: The brave Viking believed he would enter Valhalla after death
In Norse mythology, Odin presides over Valhalla's great hall

definitions: female figure in Norse mythology who chooses warriors for Valhalla
examples: The valkyrie descended from the sky to select fallen heroes
In Wagner's opera, Br√ºnnhilde is the most famous valkyrie

definitions: major seaport city in British Columbia on Canada's Pacific coast
examples: Vancouver hosted the Winter Olympics in twenty ten
The flight from Seattle to Vancouver takes less than an hour

definitions: person who deliberately destroys or damages public or private property
examples: Vandals spray-painted graffiti all over the school walls
Security cameras were installed to catch the vandals in action

definitions: island country in the South Pacific Ocean east of Australia
examples: Vanuatu consists of roughly eighty islands in the Pacific
Tourism is a major industry in Vanuatu's tropical paradise

definitions: independent city-state that serves as headquarters of the Roman Catholic Church
examples: The Vatican houses priceless art collections including the Sistine Chapel
Thousands of pilgrims visit the Vatican to see the Pope

definitions: ancient Sanskrit religious text that forms the foundation of Hinduism
examples: The Rigveda is the oldest of the four Vedas
Hindu priests chant verses from the Veda during ceremonies

definitions: philosophical tradition based on the teachings found in the Upanishads and Vedas
examples: Vedanta explores the nature of reality and consciousness deeply
Many spiritual seekers study Vedanta to understand ultimate truth

definitions: fifth brightest star in Earth's night sky located in constellation Lyra
examples: Vega served as the pole star around twelve thousand BCE
Astronomers use Vega as a reference point for stellar brightness

definitions: fabric fastener with two strips that stick together when pressed
examples: The child's shoes have velcro straps instead of laces
Astronauts use velcro to secure items in zero gravity

definitions: person who comes from or lives in Venice Italy
horizontal slatted window blind that can be adjusted for light
examples: The venetian merchant traded goods throughout the Mediterranean Sea
Many venetians work in tourism serving millions of visitors
She adjusted the venetian blinds to block the afternoon sun
The office installed new venetian blinds for better privacy

definitions: nation on the northern coast of South America bordering Colombia and Brazil
examples: Venezuela has the world's largest proven oil reserves underground
Angel Falls in Venezuela is the world's highest waterfall

definitions: person who comes from or has citizenship in the country of Venezuela
examples: The venezuelan chef prepared traditional arepas for the guests
Many venezuelans have emigrated due to economic difficulties recently

definitions: historic city in northeastern Italy built on islands connected by canals
examples: Venice attracts millions of tourists who ride gondolas annually
The flooding in Venice threatens its ancient buildings and art

definitions: referring to John Venn who invented overlapping circle diagrams for logic
examples: Students use Venn diagrams to compare and contrast concepts
The Venn diagram showed the intersection of three data sets

definitions: city in northeastern France known for major World War One battle
examples: The Battle of Verdun lasted three hundred days in 1916
Verdun symbolizes the devastating losses of World War One

definitions: alternative spelling of Virgil the ancient Roman poet of the Aeneid
examples: Some scholars prefer spelling the poet's name as Vergil
Vergil's epic poem influenced Western literature for centuries afterward

definitions: state in New England known for maple syrup mountains and autumn foliage
examples: Vermont produces more maple syrup than any other US state
Skiing in Vermont attracts thousands of winter sports enthusiasts

definitions: auxiliary scale on measuring instruments that allows precise readings between main divisions
examples: The vernier caliper measured the metal part to thousandths precision
Engineers rely on vernier scales for extremely accurate measurements

definitions: city in northern Italy famous as the setting for Romeo and Juliet
examples: Tourists visit Verona to see Juliet's supposed balcony location
The Roman amphitheater in Verona still hosts opera performances

definitions: brand of motor scooter manufactured by Piaggio known for distinctive design
examples: She rode her vintage Vespa through the streets of Rome
The classic Vespa became an icon of Italian style worldwide

definitions: evening prayer service in Christian liturgy typically held at sunset
examples: The monks gathered in the chapel for vespers every evening
The vesper bells called the community to evening prayer

definitions: Roman goddess of hearth home and family worshipped by vestals
one of the largest asteroids in the solar system's main belt
examples: The temple of Vesta housed Rome's sacred eternal flame
Priestesses of Vesta maintained the fire for over thousand years
The spacecraft Dawn orbited Vesta to study its composition
Vesta is visible to the naked eye under dark skies

definitions: brand name drug used to treat erectile dysfunction in adult males
examples: The doctor prescribed viagra to treat his medical condition
Viagra revolutionized treatment options when introduced in nineteen ninety-eight

definitions: city in central France known for mineral springs and World War Two government
examples: Vichy water from the springs was exported throughout Europe
The Vichy government collaborated with Nazi Germany during occupation

definitions: city in Mississippi known for pivotal Civil War siege and battle
examples: The siege of Vicksburg gave Union control of the Mississippi
Vicksburg National Military Park preserves the historic battlefield site

definitions: Queen of United Kingdom who reigned from eighteen thirty-seven to nineteen zero one
southeastern state of Australia with Melbourne as its capital city
examples: Queen Victoria ruled during the height of British imperial power
The Victorian era was named after Queen Victoria's long reign
Victoria produces much of Australia's dairy and agricultural products
Melbourne is the largest city in the state of Victoria

definitions: relating to the reign of Queen Victoria or the values of that era
examples: The victorian house featured ornate gingerbread trim and turrets
Victorian morality emphasized strict social codes and proper behavior

definitions: capital and largest city of Austria known for music art and architecture
examples: Vienna was home to Mozart Beethoven and many famous composers
The Vienna State Opera attracts music lovers from around world

definitions: nation in Southeast Asia on the Indochina Peninsula bordering China and Laos
examples: Vietnam has emerged as a major rice exporter in Asia
The Vietnam War ended with reunification in nineteen seventy-five

definitions: person who comes from or has citizenship in the country of Vietnam
official language of Vietnam spoken by over ninety million people worldwide
examples: The vietnamese restaurant serves authentic pho and spring rolls
Many vietnamese immigrated to America after the war ended
She's learning vietnamese to communicate with her husband's family
Vietnamese uses six different tones to distinguish word meanings

definitions: medieval Scandinavian warrior who raided and traded across Europe by ship
examples: Vikings sailed their longships as far as North America
The viking raid on Lindisfarne shocked medieval Christian Europe

definitions: large elegant house usually in the countryside or by the sea
examples: They rented a villa in Tuscany for their summer vacation
The Roman villa had beautiful mosaics and frescoed walls

definitions: bowed string instrument slightly larger and lower pitched than a violin
flowering plant with heart-shaped leaves and purple yellow or white blooms
examples: The viola plays the inner harmony in the string quartet
She switched from violin to viola for its warmer tone
Wild violas bloom in the garden every spring season
The viola's delicate petals attracted butterflies and bees daily

definitions: ancient Roman poet who wrote the Aeneid about the founding of Rome
examples: Virgil's Aeneid tells the story of Aeneas fleeing Troy
Dante chose Virgil as his guide through Hell and Purgatory

definitions: person who has never had sexual intercourse with another person
something in its original pure or untouched natural condition
examples: Some religions value remaining a virgin until marriage ceremony
The virgin bride wore white on her wedding day
The explorer discovered virgin forest untouched by human development
Virgin olive oil comes from the first cold pressing

definitions: state on the Atlantic coast known as birthplace of eight US presidents
examples: Virginia was one of the original thirteen American colonies
Colonial Williamsburg in Virginia recreates eighteenth century life authentically

definitions: person who comes from or lives in the US state of Virginia
examples: George Washington was a proud virginian and plantation owner
Many virginians work in government jobs near Washington DC

definitions: sixth astrological sign for people born between August twenty-third and September twenty-second
examples: As a virgo, she's known for being organized and analytical
The virgo constellation appears in the night sky during spring

definitions: major Hindu god who preserves and protects the universe from evil
examples: Vishnu appears in ten avatars including Krishna and Rama
Hindu temples dedicated to Vishnu attract millions of devotees

definitions: member of western Gothic tribe that invaded the Roman Empire
examples: The Visigoths sacked Rome in the year four ten
Visigoth kingdoms ruled much of Spain for three centuries

definitions: longest river in Poland flowing through Warsaw to the Baltic Sea
examples: The Vistula River divides Warsaw into two distinct sections
Cargo ships navigate the Vistula to reach Polish ports

definitions: Italian baroque composer famous for The Four Seasons violin concertos
examples: Vivaldi composed over five hundred concertos during his lifetime
The Four Seasons by Vivaldi remains incredibly popular today

definitions: major Russian port city on the Pacific Ocean near Chinese border
examples: The Trans-Siberian Railway ends its journey in Vladivostok
Vladivostok serves as Russia's main Pacific naval base

definitions: longest river in Europe flowing through Russia to the Caspian Sea
examples: The Volga River is central to Russian culture and history
Cruise ships carry tourists along the scenic Volga route

definitions: major Russian city on the Volga River formerly known as Stalingrad
examples: Volgograd was the site of a crucial World War Two battle
The massive statue in Volgograd commemorates the Battle of Stalingrad
